intro: Lacmellea pygmaea var. pygmaea, commonly known as the miniature lacmellea, is a small, delicate plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental value. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or shaded areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate species with limited distribution.
